definition: one's thoughts in a whirl (idiom); confused/disconcerted/upset
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
as/as if/such as
generic name for hemp, flax etc/hemp or flax fiber for textile materials/sesame/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/(of materials) rough or coarse/pocked/pitted/to have pins and needles or tingling/to feel numb
surname Ma

sentences.english: She was restless and even agitated.
sentences.chinese: 她坐立不安，甚至心亂如麻。

sentences.english: Oh, I don't even know how to comprehend what's going on.
sentences.chinese: 唉，我都不知道現在正在發生什麼，心亂如麻。

sentences.english: The president, being told of the strong earthquake in his country, was on tenterhooks every minute.
sentences.chinese: 得知本國發生了強烈地震，總統一直心亂如麻。

sentences.english: All I had to do was not open the door. The bell almost shattered my jangled …nerves.
sentences.chinese: 我本已心亂如麻，門鈴聲幾乎要將我擊倒。

sentences.english: Not on this ride - the Steel Dragon is quite the endurance coaster.
sentences.chinese: “終極飛車”的旅程從開始就會讓你心亂如麻。

sentences.english: When I woke up, I was so disturbed that I couldn't shake off the image.
sentences.chinese: 醒來後，我心亂如麻，無法擺脫那個形象。

sentences.english: Job-hunting has failed again and again. It has made me terribly upset.
sentences.chinese: 找工作處處碰壁，搞得我心亂如麻。

definition: (of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
to remain unmoved
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
(idiom) impossible to fault/impeccable
to keep silent
variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to produce clouds with one turn of the hand and rain with another (idiom); fig. to shift one's ground/tricky and inconstant/to make love
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to be obsessed/to be possessed
young people decked out in gorgeous clothes (idiom)
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
false alarm/panic rumor/CL:場|场[chang2]
